Problem 3.2

Designing Under Constraints: Scale Factors and Similar Shapes (Scale Drawings)

The scale factor provides information about how side lengths, perimeters and areas of the figures are related. It

  • is the ratio of an image side length to the corresponding side length of the original;
  • is the multiplier that connects the original length to the image length; and
  • tells us how one length grows or shrinks by a certain factor.

In Problem 3.2, we use scale drawings to make similar shapes given a set of constraints (criteria).
